title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Production and detection of X-rays. Basic crystallography of materials Symmetry Elements, Point Groups, Space Groups. Reciprocal lattice. Analysis of diffracted beam direction - Bragg approach and Laue approach. Intensities of diffracted beams: Scattering from single electron, atom, unit cell, small crystal â the kinametical theory of x-ray diffraction. Single crystal diffraction methods and their applications. Modern powder diffraction methods. Indexing of powder diffraction patterns. Precise lattice parameter estimation. Determination of crystal structures from symmetry and geometry, and Patterson, direct and Fourier methods. Rietveled method and precise crystal structures. Qualitative and quantitative phase identification. Preferred orientation. Grain size and microstrain, Residual stress. Order-disorder transformations. Diffraction from thin films. Neutron diffraction. Theory of electron diffraction, geometry of electron diffraction and their applications, microdiffraction.
